title: Smithsonian Design Museum
content:
Cooper Hewitt, Smithsonian Design Museum presents “Beauty” exhibition, with projects ranging from experimental prototypes and interactive games to fashion ensembles and architectural interventions. Featuring work by the most outstanding voices in the global design scene. it expands the discourse around the transformative power of aesthetic innovation. The exhibition explores beauty through seven lenses: extravagant, intricate, ethereal, transgressive, emergent, elemental and transformative, celebrating design as a creative endeavor that engages the mind, body and senses with works of astonishing form and surprising function.

 

Organized by Curators Andrea Lipps and Ellen Lupton

 

Feb. 12 – Aug. 21, 2016

news_photo.title: Cooper Hewitt Smithsonian Design museum_Ana Rajcevic

title: The Mint Museum
content:
“Body Embellishment” Exhibition

 

Apr 11 2015 – Sep 06 2015
500 S. Tryon Street
Charlotte, NC 28202

 

Body Embellishment explores the most innovative artistic expression in the 21st-century international arenas of body extension, augmentation, and modification. The areas of focus are jewelry, tattoos, nail arts, and fashion.

 

Select fashion alters or distorts the architecture of the body. The juxtaposition of these varied forms, deriving from popular culture as well as the worlds of art, craft, and design, bring to light the visual and conceptual parallels among them. The exhibition’s underlying premise is that examining collectively these most extreme and avant-garde forms of body art will illuminate the cultural meaning of body embellishment in general.

news_popup_photo.title: The-Mint-Museum-Exhibition-Ana-Rajcevic
news_popup_photo.caption: The-Mint-Museum-Exhibition-Ana-Rajcevic

title: Design Biennale
content:
The Vous avez dit bizarre ? (Did you say bizarre?) exhibition explores the notion of the contemporary grotesque through a selection of about forty designers.

 

Co-directed and co-designed by Dutch artist Bart Hess and art historian Alexandra Jaffré, the exhibition brings together design projects that play with the codes of the grotesque style to demonstrate the social implications of behaviours that can sometimes be over-the-top.

 

The grotesque is commonly regarded as a ridiculous, exaggerated character. And yet, its semantic field, generous, fluid and changing, allows the expression of anything from the ridiculous to the absurd with humour, mockery or uneasiness.

 

12 Mar – 12 Apr 2015

news_popup_photo.title: International Design Biennale Saint Etienne_Ana Rajcevic
news_popup_photo.caption: International Design Biennale Saint Etienne_Ana Rajcevic

news_photo.title: International Design Biennale Saint Etienne_Ana Rajcevic_small

title: Trapholt Museum
content:
Curated by Lidewij Edelkoort, the exhibition presents 100 of the hottest names on the global design scene to participate within the themes Nudism, Sado-Masochism, Romanticism, Spiritualism, Absurdism, Infantilism, Regionalism, Consumerism, Shamanism and Legendism.

 

Edelkoort’s defining point of view is that we, to an increasing degree, use design as fetishes in order to connect in a more and more complex world. Taking psychology as an off-set, she argues that a personal inclination towards a certain type of fetish most likely can be traced back to our own childhood.

 

12 Mar 2015 – 24 Jan 2016

Kolding . Danmark

acf.news_short_description: Museum of Modern Art, Applied Art, Design and Architecture

title: Bonington Gallery
content:
Crafting Anatomies Exhibition

 

By placing the human body at the center of a multi-disciplinary dialogue; the exhibition will explore how this entity has been interpreted, crafted and reimagined in historical, contemporary and future contexts.

 

It will showcase visionary practices of leading international artists, clinicians and designers alongside anatomical exhibits selected from historical collections including films from The Welcome Trust archive.

 

43 practitioners in total will take part, including, Shelly Goldsmith, Amy Congdon, Richard Arm, John Pacey-Lowrie, Ana Rajcevic, Juliana Sissons, and many more.

title: Museum Boijmans
content:
Museum Boijmans Van Beuningen

Rotterdam Netherlands


11 October 2014 – 18th january 2015


“The Future of Fashion is Now” exhibition, showcasing my  “Animal-The Other Side of Evolution” pieces

 

The exhibition brings together innovative creations by more than 50 fashion designers from around the world, who all actively search for ways to redefine the culture of fast fashion in today’s society.

 

Designers included: Viktor & Rolf, Hussein Chalayan, Iris van Herpen, Craig Green, Rejina Pyo, Ricarda Bigolin & Nella Themelios of D&K, Lucia Cuba, Christophe Coppens, Ana Rajcevic, Pyuupiru, Comme des Garçons  Rei Kawakubo, Lara Torres, Maison Martin Margiela  and many others.

title: FACELESS II exhibition
content:
Curated by Bogomir Doringer,  with the support of Brigitte Felderer, Faceless exhibition explores the phenomenon of the fashion of “facelessness” that appeared in the creative arts at the beginning of this century & has remained popular since then.

 

After its premier in Museum Qurtier in Wienna, this July, the exhibition moved to Mediamatic in Amsterdam

 

Mediamatic, 26 Jan – 30 Apr 2014

voc-kade 10, 1018 Amsterdam, NL

title: ORIGIN Event
content:
I was privileged to be one of 15 designers invited by Not Just A Label to attend the Origin teaser event.

 

ORIGIN, PASSION & BELIEFS, an initiative which NJAL have now been developing  in collaboration with Fiera Di Vicenza, the international creative event organisation responsible for VINCENZAORO, one of the world’s most prominent jewellery shows.

With further endorsement from Italy’s leading luxury fashion and jewellery houses, the Venice Art Biennale and IUAV, the country’s most renowned fashion design institution, ORIGIN aims to bring together traditional and regional manufacturing houses with young and exciting design talents from five continents, developing a concept to enhance the ‘Made in Italy’ label

 

Origin Event

4th-7th July 2013

Venice:, Italy

 

www.notjustalabel.com/editorial/ana-rajcevic

title: FUTURE FASHION
content:
Focusing on innovators of fashion and sculpture for the body, Future Fashion Exhibition explores the work of fashion, jewellery and shoe designers who are embracing – and transforming – craft skills and techniques through innovative design thinking, sculptural aesthetic, and cutting-edge technology and materials.

 

Including Úna Burke, Andreia Chaves, Marloes ten Bhomer, Stephanie Bila, Ana Rajcevic and Julia Lundsten of FINSK, Future Fashion explores a fascinating range of approaches to contemporary fashion.

 

 

Curated by Angela O’Kelly

 

 

9 August 2013 – 16 October 2013
National Craft Gallery,

Kilkenny Arts Festival

Kilkeny Ireland

title: FACELESS exhibition
content:
The exhibition “FACELESS” at Fraulein Quartier 21 INTERNATIONAL/ MQ
presents contemporary works from the worlds of art and fashion in which faces are hidden, transformed, or masked.

 

Artists including Marina Abramovic, Thorsten Brinkmann, Asger Carlsen, Shahram Entekhabi, David Haines, Ren Hang, Ute Klein, Nienke Klunder, Manu Luksch, Slava Mogutin, Mustafa Sabbagh, Jan Stradtmann, Levi van Veluw, Maison Martin Margiela, Ana Rajcevic, Lucy McRae, Bart Hess,
Damier Johnson aka REBEL YUTHS,, Gareth Pugh, Viktor & Rolf and many many others

 

Curated by Bogomir Doringer and Brigitte Felderera

 

 

04 July – 01 Sept 2013

MuseumsQuartier

content:
I will be exhibiting some of the pieces from my “Animal – The Other Side of Evolution” project at the SHOWstudio cabinet exhibition: Prosthetics,

 

The exhibition aims to present an array of items from innovators in fashion and art who embrace augmentation and aesthetics in tackling the idea of bodily enhancement and extension.

 

Artworks by amazing Una Burke, Aimee Mullins, Betony Vernon, Kat Marks, Patrick Ian Hartley, Dai Rees, Kyle Hopkins, Naomi Filmer, Tara Dougans, Yiqing Yin and Ana Rajcevic..

 

SHOWStudio Gallery

 

18th April – 31st May 2013
19 Motcomb Street
Belgravia
London SW1X 8LB

title: WONDERINGMODE
content:
Animal – The Other Side of Evolution collection will be on display at Wonderingmode exhibition, in Center for Contemporary Art in Torun, PL. The exhibition explores and presents cutting-edge research in the domains of art, design, fashion and architecture and their mutual crossovers.

In collaboration with: Linda Loppa, director of Polimoda, Florence/ Kaat Debo, director of MoMU – Fashion , Museum, Antwerp/ Helena Hertov, founder of Fashionplay, Stockholm/ Annemartine van Kesteren, curator at Museum Boijmans Van Beuningen, Rotterdam/ Stefan Siegel, founder of NOT JUST A LABEL, London.

Artists included: Hussein Chalayan, Iris van Herpen, Marloes Ten Bhomer, Yuima Nakazato, Tomoko Hayashi, Naomi Filmer, Anna-Nicole Ziesche, Minna Palmqvist, Emilia Tikka, Mina Lundgren, Kim Hagelind, Ana Rajcevic, Ruth Hogben, Bogomir Doringer , Daniel Widrig.

Curated by: Dobrila Denegri

 

15th March – 26th May 2013

title: Project of the Year
content:
Accessories Collection of the Year: Ana Rajcevic

 

 

Very nice words from:

 

Robbie Spencer in Dazed and Confused Magazine


“LCF accessories graduate Ana’s Rajcevic’s horn-like animalistic headpieces were extremely beautiful and also slightly disturbing. The level or craft and simplicity really made them stand out amongst the other accessory submissions, I can’t wait to shoot them for something soon!”

 

Ger Tierney in I-D Magazine

 

“Ana Rajcevic, an incredibly talented and charismatic girl who created stunning, thought-provoking headpieces for inner goddesses and animal spirits.”

title: Wired exhibition
content:
Belgrade (May 25th – May 29th, 2009)

Inside the flour factory “Zitomlin”.

 

The installation features an accompanying soundtrack by Lukatoyboy, comprised of sounds made in contact with various metals, in city dumps, construction sites, streets, as well as in the artist’s studio during the making of sculptures.

 

photo by Vladimir Miladinovic
